intro: Peucedanum cameroonsum, commonly known as Cameroon angelica, is a flowering plant native to the Cameroon region of Central Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. However, it is not widely cultivated or studied compared to other members of its family.
